alert.note: Alert for Richland (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 05 at 10:04PM CST until March 05 at 11:30PM CST by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM CST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Wisconsin, including the following county, Richland. * WHEN...Until 100 AM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1002 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Law enforcement reported a few road closures due to the flooding. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Richland Center, Boscobel, Germantown, Westport, Excelsior, Lone Rock, Rockbridge, Viola, Ithaca, Sylvan, Boaz, Yuba, Highways 80 And 56, County Roads Z Z And Q, County Roads A And Z, Gillingham, Buck Creek, Woodstock, Highway 80 And County Y and County Roads E And Q. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
